wikipedia_page.main: Cyril Percival (1889–1948) was a British film actor of the silent era.

response: * The Knave of Diamonds or Le Valet de Carreau with Mary Massart and Cyril Percival (UK, 1921)

The Sport of Kings is a 1921 British silent sports film directed by Arthur Rooke and starring Victor McLaglen, Douglas Munro and Cyril Percival. The screenplay concerns a man who tries to prevent his wealthy ward from marrying a man involved in the horseracing world.
* Cyril Percival as Captain Horace Vail
* Cyril Percival as John Howard Edel
| The Missioner || George Ridgwell || Cyril Percival, Pauline Peters || Crime ||
The Missioner is a 1922 British silent crime film directed by George Ridgwell and starring Cyril Percival, Pauline Peters and Olaf Hytten.Goble p.352

The Knave of Diamonds is a 1921 British silent drama film directed by René Plaissetty and starring Mary Massart, Alec Fraser and Cyril Percival. It is an adaptation of the 1913 novel of the same title by Ethel M. Dell.Goble p.122
